descriptionProfile: Los Angeles, Latin America and Beyond... Runa // Panos // Nat Geo
Los Angeles, Latin America and Beyond... Runa // Panos // Nat Geo

posts.description:
Link in profile: Karla (@kchete77) and Ivan will be presenting their work on the Wealthy Roma of Buzescu at the Annenberg Space for Photography (@annenbergspace) in Los Angeles on Saturday, May 13th.  Mexico-based photographer Yvonne (@yvovenegas) will be showing her work as well. Please check the link in my profile for tickets.

Vandana Ispilante sits with her daughter, Edera, 13, in a bedroom in Buzescu, a small town in Romania.  Buzescu is known for its ultra-wealthy Roma and their bizarre mansions that line the main street.  The Roma of Buzescu are part of the Kalderash clan. #photography, #comingsoon, @runa_photos, @panospicture, @natgeo, @thephotosociety
Night hike. Wildwood, Thousand Oaks, CA. #runaflirts, @runa_photos

#WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Letting Out Aggression // When you “break the wood and then make a fire, you’re letting your aggression out and then setting it free.” Anastasia was running from an abusive relationship when she arrived in this community where she felt safe. Ana told me she had a dark childhood.  Her father was murdered and her mother, who would shoot heroin in front of her, died in a car crash with Ana's sister. Despite this darkness, Ana was extremely giving and well liked by almost everyone in the community.  #runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

#WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Smoke // Bones, one of the gatekeepers, smokes meth in the “homeless mansion” near the LA River, Los Angeles. Bones, 49, has spent 21 years in prison.  He says that he has taken some of the rules from prison and applied them to the community. “Without order there is chaos,” he told me. Some come to the community for protection.  Bones got his nickname because he’s known to be a good fighter and has broken a few jawbones. He says he doesn’t like to fight, but he’s stubborn and won’t back down.  #runaflirts,@runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

#WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Ana and Bones // Bones, one of the gatekeepers of the community, puts his nose to Bianca’s nose, while Anastasia hangs out at Steve’s camp on the LA River in Los Angeles. Bones and Anastasia are two of the key people who let me into this homeless community. Ana took me to meet Bones.  I walked up to him and said, “Hi, are you Bones?” He looked me straight in the eye and said, “Who the f*ck are you?” After that first moment of awkwardness, he relaxed and allowed me to begin documenting their community. #Runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures
A man walks by a mural of the Virgen de Guadalupe in the Mariachi Plaza in Boyle Heights, LA. #onassignment for @nytimes, #runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures
#WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Dusk falls into night on the LA River after a storm. #Runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures
#WalkingtheLAwash // Style // A raised car is parked on a street by the LA River in Winnetka, #LA, #CA, #USA. #carculture, #LAriver, #runaflirts, @panospictures, @thephotosociety, @runa_photos

#WalkingtheLAwash // #NicoleandMarkLAwash // Busted // Mark, far left, waits on the 9th floor of the Los Angeles Municipal Court in Van Nuys, #CA, #USA. Mark, who was out on a twenty thousand dollar bail bond, was waiting for a court appointment regarding his 4th felony, which he received for selling heroin. Nicole and Mark were selling #heroin on Craig's list, with the code word being “black roof tar.” Undercover cops busted them. They got off with six months inpatient and three years of probation. Nicole and Mark are now in sober living houses and have jobs at a call center. Mark: “I remember the first time I shot it. I went in my mother’s bathroom and it took me about twenty pokes, because I used to be so scared of needles. And how quickly my life turned shitty is almost biblical. I went from the friendly neighborhood weed guy to committing burglary almost every single day.” #runaflirts, @thephotosociety, @panospictures, @runa_photos

#WalkingtheLAwash // #NicoleandMarkLAwash // Nicole and Mark prepare to shoot heroin in back of a gas station in #Reseda, #LA. They had been in and out of countless rehabs. Their whole day revolved around panhandling and pulling together money for the next bag. The couple often talked about cleaning up, getting an apartment, and owning a cat, but these days were spent between Jack in the Box, the 99 cent store, and wherever they could score more heroin.  Nicole and Mark are now in sober living houses and have jobs at a call center. #runaflirts, @panospictures, @thephotosociety, @runa_photos

A woman walks out of the "Time Tunnel" in #Topanga, CA, USA. I used to walk down this large tunnel, which leads to Topanga Creek, when I was a boy. #SantaMonicaMountains, #runaflirts, @runa_photos, @panospicuters, @thephotosociety

Click the link in my profile to view.
Thrilled to be featured on National Geographic Proof along with so much talent! Read about how Karla (@kchete77) and Ivan, as well as other photo couples, share the passion of photography. Thanks to Jessie (@jmwender) for this intimate post. 
Karla and I photographed this amazing tango couple on our journey form Ecuador to Tierra del Fuego.
Big Love!
Photo:  Cecilia Rodríguez and Emmanuel Casal dance the tango on El Caminito, a traditional alley, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on April 11, 2009.  Ceci and Meme were a tango couple that danced for tips from tourists.  They were both lovers and friends who fought, kissed, and roamed the streets of Buenos Aires.  They often ended the night in milongas, where they would tango. 
#runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures
#WalkingtheLAwash // Dance Moves // Juan, from El Salvador, practices his breakdancing moves in the LA River, in #Encino, Los Angeles. #Runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // The Pink Rose // Ashley Heldman, 29, stands alongside a fence with colored leaves boarding the #LARiver in the San Fernando Valley. As she opened a fresh bottle of vodka, she told me that her family and now her boyfriend, who had left a few days ago, had rejected her. As she broke down in tears she said that her mom, who used to hit her, died from chronic alcohol abuse. Ashley has left the community and is sober. #Runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

#WalkingtheLAwash // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Houseless // Tim looks into the lens during a long conversation as dusk falls over the #LARiver in Los Angeles. He was high on crystal, the omnipresent drug in this community. Tim, who was camping along the river, preferred to call himself “houseless” rather than “homeless.” #runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

#WalkingtheLAwash // Alan and the Homeless Mansion // #WhereTheConcreteMeetsTheJungle // Alan Fagerson, 54, sits in what has been dubbed his “homeless mansion,” just off the #LARiver, in Balboa Lake, Los Angeles. Alan moved to the San Fernando Valley when he was 19 and finished a fifteen-year prison sentence a few years back. The structure, made of wood and found material, even has a guestroom. #runaflirts, @runa_photos, @thephotosociety, @panospictures

Adebola Afolabi, of the Viver Brasil Dance Co, throws her hands in the air as hundreds of thousand of people take the streets during the Women’s March in downtown Los Angeles on January 21, 2017. #runaflirts, @panospictures, @runa_photos, @natgeo, @thephotosociety, #viverbrasil
